cognitive.label: Remember
cognitive.desc: Retrieve relevant knowledge from long-term memory.

cognitive.label: Understand
cognitive.desc: Construct meaning from instructional messages, including oral, written, and graphic communication.

cognitive.label: Apply
cognitive.desc: Carry out or use a procedure in a given situation.

cognitive.label: Analyze
cognitive.desc: Break material into constituent parts and determine how parts relate to one another and to an overall structure or purpose.

cognitive.label: Evaluate
cognitive.desc: Make judgements based on criteria and standards.

cognitive.label: Create
cognitive.desc: Put elements together to form a coherent whole; reorganize into a new pattern or structure.

knowledge.label: Factual
knowledge.desc: The basic elements students must know to be acquainted with a discipline or solve problems in it.

knowledge.label: Conceptual
knowledge.desc: The interrelationships among the basic elements within a larger structure that enable them to function together.

knowledge.label: Procedural
knowledge.desc: How to do something, methods of inquiry, and criteria for using skills, algorithms, techniques, and methods.

knowledge.label: Metacognitive
knowledge.desc: Knowledge of cognition in general as well as awareness and knowledge of one's own cognition.

ai_literacy.label: Hardware & Software
ai_literacy.desc: Know which AI tool to use; use AI tools and features on phone/tablet/laptop/desktop.

ai_literacy.label: Information & Data Literacy
ai_literacy.desc: Use AI to access new info and organize data; evaluate AI output; modify techniques to improve AI performance.

ai_literacy.label: Communication & Collaboration
ai_literacy.desc: Converse with AI systems and chatbots; manage and share AI content; determine whether/how to acknowledge AI; use AI in collaboration with others.

ai_literacy.label: Content Creation
ai_literacy.desc: Use AI to create and personalize new content and adapt existing content; understand legal and ethical issues with AI datasets, models, and output.

ai_literacy.label: Safety
ai_literacy.desc: Know risks and liabilities of AI tools; review privacy policies for data usage; manage risks to personal info and wellbeing; use AI in ethical ways and assess environmental impact.

ai_literacy.label: Problem Solving
ai_literacy.desc: Recognize errors and inconsistencies in outputs; identify and solve AI-related problems; use AI to create insights and improve processes; identify skill gaps and continually learn.

ai_literacy.label: Career Competencies
ai_literacy.desc: Use and customize AI tools in a specific field; understand and analyze AI content in that field; combine industry expertise with AI analysis and processes.
